publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3696 Robin Harper: Congratulations to Aberdeen Foyer on Bumblebee Work—That the Parliament congratulates Aberdeen Foyer on the work that it has done planting wild flowers, nectar-bearing plants and shrubs that will provide nutrition for bumblebees and butterflies; recognises the bumblebee as the principle pollinating insect in the Scottish countryside, and calls on the Scottish Government to recognise and support the important work being done at the University of Stirling to research and find ways to overcome the threats to bumblebees that have rendered three of Scotland’s 25 bumblebee species extinct and a further seven species severely threatened.

S3M-3696 Congratulations to Aberdeen Foyer on Bumblebee Work (lodged on 13 March 2009) Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Kenneth Gibson*, Brian Adam*, Patrick Harvie*, Mike Pringle*, Bill Wilson*, Ken Macintosh*
S3M-3696 Congratulations to Aberdeen Foyer on Bumblebee Work (lodged on 13 March 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Alison McInnes*, Nanette Milne*, Peter Peacock*
S3M-3696 Congratulations to Aberdeen Foyer on Bumblebee Work (lodged on 13 March 2009) David Stewart*
S3M-3696 Congratulations to Aberdeen Foyer on Bumblebee Work (lodged on 13 March 2009) Hugh Henry*
S3M-3696 Congratulations to Aberdeen Foyer on Bumblebee Work (lodged on 13 March 2009) Stuart McMillan*
